Class SimpleMoney

public class SimpleMoney extends Object implements Money
This class represents a SimpleMoney which implements Money interface.

    • SimpleMoney

      public SimpleMoney(int dollar, int cent) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs a money in terms of its dollar and cent values.
      Parameters:
      dollar - dollar value of the money
      cent - cent value of the money
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a negative amount of money, or using a negative amount of dollars or cents

    • getDecimalValue

      public double getDecimalValue()
      Description copied from interface: Money
      A method that returns the decimal value of the money in the format "xx.yy". The cent value should be padded with leading zeroes if necessary (i.e. 8 dollars and 2 cents should be 8.02).
      Specified by:
      getDecimalValue in interface Money
      Returns:
      a decimal value of the money

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides to return a string of the form "$xx.yy". There should be exactly two digits after the decimal point, padded with leading zeroes if necessary. 7 + 22 => 7.22 or 7 + 2 => 7.02
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      formatted string as "$xx.yy"
